channel.title: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?
channel.description:
Many have heard the tale of the amazing 'Rotten Potato' item that Jagex use in RuneScape for their commands/abilities. What I want to know, is how do I make the rotten potato's options actually execute commands, and how do I change what the options are named?
Here's a picture of the rotten potato's option list: [IMG]http://i1031.photobucket.com/albums/y380/mrpopyman/rottenpotato_zps672affeb.png[/img]
Currently, the potato doesn't do anything and the options don't do anything when they're selected.
P.S. I also would like to know if this is client-sided or server-sided.
All help is appreciated.
Thanks.

@mrpopyman wrote:

Can’t you please just tell me what to do…? I’m confused…

item.title: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“mrpopyman, post:7, topic:547988”]Okay, so thanks for the help guys, but where do I put all this stuff? Player.java? Commands.java?

???[/quote]
Think a bit more logical. Does the First click item packet have anything to do with the Commands packet? I don’t think it does.
If you look at the packets you might get a better understand on where it goes.

item.title: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Sup22211, post:5, topic:547988”]On the server side, at the item action switch case you can make it debug so every button you click, it will tell you the id. then just build the action you want to be executed on click for example:

case ID: //action break; [/quote]
I’m just giving you shit here… So don’t get mad.
But button? What are buttons gonna tell him when he’s clicking an item? x3
I know, you said the wrong word.

Read full topic
item.source: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?

item.title: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?
item.dc:creator: @Sup22211 Sup22211
item.description:
@Sup22211 wrote:

On the server side, at the item action switch case you can make it debug so every button you click, it will tell you the id. then just build the action you want to be executed on click for example:

case ID:
//action
break;

Read full topic
item.source: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?

item.title: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Right click options are client sided:

case YOUR_ITEM_ID: itemDef.itemActions = new String[] { "", "", "", "", "" }; break;
Note: Your actions may not be called itemActions.
Note 2: any unused option should be replaced with the word ‘null’ and no quotes.

Server sided it will depend on what actions you want done.
If opening an interface, you can send the packet for it. IF a custom interface, you have to first add the custom interface to the client.

Read full topic
item.source: The Fabled Rotten Potato - Is There A Way to Make It Actually Work?
